intro: Maytenus apurimacensis, commonly known as the Apurimac mayten, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, montane forests at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain seeds, and it plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing food for various wildlife species.
